body: Yes, that is a long-term goal for GLFW.

issue.title: Compile platform specific code as modules

milestone.title: None
milestone.description: This is for issues that do not belong to any milestone, to tell them apart from un-reviewed issues closed by the submitter.

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
This is a suggestion. While I understand the simplicity of making this compile-time.
It is also major PITA to recompile projects or use different version of library when running program in different environments (mainly on linux). 

Such combinations include wayland + egl + glfw program, x11 + glx + glfw program, x11 + egl.
It would be great if platform code was compiled into modules, and then automatically try pick the best one, but overrideable with env variable. Modules that support both GLX/EGL, should probably default to what makes most sense, but allow overriding with env variable as well.

In future we might even have vulkan support to complicate this scheme even further.

It could also be possible to use dlopen instead of compiling to modules, to avoid issue where program needs to provide the modules + libglfw, however dlopen brings burden of maintaining function declarations.

issue.title: version string mix up

repository.name: lwjgl3
repository.description: LWJGL is a Java library that enables cross-platform access to popular native APIs useful in the development of graphics (OpenGL, Vulkan, bgfx), audio (OpenAL, Opus), parallel computing (OpenCL, CUDA) and XR (OpenVR, LibOVR, OpenXR) applications.

body: The compile-time client library options have been removed, as that is now handled at runtime. Selection between EGL and native APIs is up next.
Moving this to 3.3 as I will be putting out a 3.2 shortly to have a release out with Vulkan support. I'm still working towards this, as well as the larger goal of run-time window system selection.
This is being worked on in the [context-api](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/tree/context-api) branch.
